Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Member of the editorial board of Continuum. Journal of Media and Cultural Studies. Published by Taylor & Francis
Member of the editorial board of the Anuario ININCO. Investigaciones de la comunicaciòn, Published by Universidad Central de Venezuela .
Member of the editorial board of Partecipazione e conflitto, published by Franco Angeli, Italy.

Member of the Editorial Board of the bi-lingual, peer reviewed and online journal Comunicação e Sociedade, published by the Centro de Estudos de Comunicação e Sociedade, Universidade do Minho, Portugal.
Co-editor of Palgrave/IAMCR international series titled Global Transformations in Media and Communication Research (together with Prof. Marjan de Bruin, University of the West Indies, Jamaica).
Member of the Editorial Board of the Journal ComPol (Comunicazione Politica), published by Il Mulino, Italy.
Member of the Editorial Board of the International Communication Gazette, published by Sage Publications, leading journal in communication studies since 1955.

Member of the Editorial Board of the Journal of Alternative and Community Media, published by Griffith University's Griffith press as an online peer-reviewed journal and supported by the IAMCR'S Community Communication section and the Griffith Centre for Cultural Research.

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Organisation of Euricom international colloquium: Information Society: Visions and Governance. The World Summit on the Information Society and beyond. Venice, Isle of San Servolo.

Plenary address on general topic “From Geneva to Tunis: lessons from the World Summit on the Information Society”, IAMCR Porto Alegre conference. In the same conference other presentations on the experience of scholars involved in the UN World Summit.
Organisation of International colloquium on The Multi-stakeholder approach in information and communication policies. Venice, Isle of San Servolo
Organisation of international seminar on 'International colloquium on The Multi-stakeholder approach in information and communication policies'. Venice, Isle of San Servolo.
Invited discussant to International seminar on 'Locating Civil Society Participation in WSIS', Oxford Internet Institute workshop, Oxford University.

Plenary address on “Learning from WSIS” in the context of plenary session on Global Governance, Equality and Action after the WSIS, IAMCR conference, Cairo. In the same context other papers were presented: Theoretical Reflections on Multi-Stakeholderism in Global Policy Processes: The WSIS as a learning space

Presentation on 'Beyond narratives: understanding processes through lexical-content analysis. Reflections from empirical investigations around the World Summit on the Information Society (WSIS)' (with Arjuna Tuzzi) at Westminster University on '‘Internationalising Media Studies: Imperatives and Impediments’

Invited discussant to international seminar organized by Feltrinelli Foundation on 'Conflict, social movements and new rights: a European challenge' held in Cortona. Panel on “Social movement, media and communication”.
Presentation on 'Communication and e.democracy: assessing European e-democracy discourses' (with Giorgia Nesti) in the context of event titled 'Per una democrazia di qualità, held in Padova.

Organisation of International Seminar: Mapping the European communicative space: assessing participatory dynamics in communication processes, technologies and policies (within PRIN project 2007-2008). University of Padova

Organisation of Panel on 'Creating Communication Rights: Perspectives on the emergence of a global social movement' (jointly with Andrew Calabrese, University of Colorado) in the context of the International Communication Association ICA, San Francisco. Presentations on: - Communication rights between political opportunities and mobilization frames: A historical perspective (with Stefania Milan) - Activist Networks, Sovereignty and the Postnational Constellation (with Andrew Calabrese)

Invited contribution to international conference on 'I destini della globalità', organised by ISPI, Milan. Presentation on “Transnational networks of mobilization around communication rights: rethinking global civil society”.

Organisation of panel in the contexts of the New Network Theory International Conference, held in Amsterdam, 28-30 June 2007 (jointly with Mario Diani, University of Trento). Panel theme: Networks and movements: an interdisciplinary conversation. Presentation on 'Between Issue and Social Network. Shading shapes of communication rights mobilization in Italy.' Between Issue and Social Network. Shading shapes of communication rights mobilization in Italy.

Plenary address at IAMCR-ICA joint panel, IAMCR conference, Paris 'Reflections on the global, the transnational and the international'. Speech on “International, transnational & global: the “second life” of communication research… “. In the same context other presentations on: 'Between theory and praxis: methodological reflections on communication studies' and chairing a round table on 'Mapping global media policy: the state of the art'

Organisation of Panel at SISP conference 'Political communication and communication policies in Europe. Media landscapes, participation and the European Democratic Deficit' (with Giorgia Nesti, University of Padova). Discussant in Panel Movimenti e partecipazione politica

Presentation on “Opportunities for Social Mobilizations around Communication Rights in Europe. A research agenda” in the context of ECREA joint session, Bruxelles. Title of session 'Equal Opportunities and Communication Rights: Representation, Participation & the European Democratic Deficit'.
Discussant in innovative panel on 'Global Multistakeholder Governance for the Information Society: Quo Vadis – Post WSIS'. ISA Conference held in San francisco,
Organisation of International Seminar on Global Media Policy Mapping: concepts, frameworks and methods (within PRIN project 2007-2008). Venice, Isle of San Servolo.
Presentation at SISP Standing Group on International Relations event in Forli. Title: 'Information Networks, Internet Governance and Innovation in World Politics' (with Pavan)

Organisation of panels within the Working Group on Global Media Policy: European Media Policies. IAMCR Conference, Stockholm (jointly organized with marc Raboy, McGill University Montreal). Organisation of panel within the Political Communication section: International Political Communication, SISP Congress, Pavia (jointly organized with Francesco Amoretti, University of Salerno). Presentation on Mapping Global Media Policy

Presentation at London School of Economics, Fifth Anniversary Conference: Media, Communication and Humanity . Presentation on 'Information Networks, Internet Governance and Innovation in World Politics'

Panel organised within the Communication and Democracy section: 'Critical reflections on the nexus between media and democracy'. Presentation at the Second International Workshop on 'Global Internet Governance: An Interdisciplinary Research Field in Construction'. Paper on 'Mapping Internet Governance: theoretical framework, research methodologies and implementation strategies (With a little help from my friends…)' (with Elena Pavan)
Organisation of International Seminar on Networks and change in global media and communication governance (within PRIN project 2007-2008). Venice, Isle of San Servolo

Invited contribution to international seminar on “Forms of execution and institutionalisation of Internet governance” held in Paris, Eccles des Mines; paper on 'Democracy and global governance, the wager of the Internet Governance Forum'

Series of Panels organised IAMCR Conference, Mexico. - Panel on: Communication as a human right: policy challenges, public interest narratives and visions for the future. (jointly organized with the Emerging Scholars Network section) - Mapping Global Media Policy (working group on Global Media Policy)

Organisation of Panel within the Political Communication section of the SISP congress 'Diritti di cittadinanza e nuovi ambienti digitali'. Jointly organized with Francesco Amoretti, University of Salerno.

Presentation at the Third International Workshop on Global Internet Governance: An Interdisciplinary Research Field in Construction, held in Montreal. Paper on 'Mapping Internet Governance: A Proposal for Scholarly Collaboration'

Presentation at the 2010 conference of the Canadian Communication Association on 'Rethinking power in world politics: the empowering potential of media monitoring and gender-based advocacy networks. Reflections on the Global Media Monitoring Project'

Organisation of a Series of Panels at IAMCR conference held in Braga, Portugal, as chair of the IAMCR Working Group on Global Media Policy. And panels in joint collaboration with other sections: joint panel titled ‘Rethinking citizenship in a globalized world: lessons from the field’ (Emerging scholars network) joint panels titled 'Women and news media in global perspective: reflections on the Global Media Monitoring Project 2009’ with Gender and communication section

Presentation at the SISP conference held in Venice, in panel Global politics & Global policies. Paper on 'Actors and interactions in Global Communication Governance: The heuristic potential of a network approach'
Presentations on Mapping Global Media Policy and Global Media Research: Issues and Case Studies, at the 2010 European Communication Research and Education Association Conference in Hamburg.

Participation at ISA conference, held in Montreal. Panel titled “Global Communication Governance and the Role of Non-State Actors” with a presentation titled “Political authority in transition: understanding global media governance”

Organisation of International Colloquium on The Democratic Wager of Communication (within PRIN project 2007-2008) (Speakers: Roberto Savio, Arne Hintz, Elena Pavan, Bart Cammartes, Annabelle Sreberny, Caroline Pauwels, Marc Raboy, Armand Mattelart, Darin Barney, Hannu Nieminen).

Organisation of series of Panels and paper presentation and Mapping Global Media Policy project developments at the IAMCR Conference on 'Cities, Creativity, Connectivity', Istanbul (as chair of the IAMCR Working Group on Global Media Policy): - ‘Glocal’ Media Policy 3C: Creativity, Connectivity and Comparative approaches - Mapping Global Media Policy. Interactive session on data collection, maps elaboration, scenarios of use and future developments

Organizzazione di Panel: New communication technologies and social mobilizations in the Middle East. SISP Congress, Palermo (jointly organized with the Political Communication Section and the Section on Political Participation and Social Movements).

Organisation of a series of panels at the IAMCR Conference, held in Durban (as chair of the WG on Global Media Policy). 1. Mapping the Globe, Mapping the Media: A South-North conversation around policy challenges. Four mapping projects that have communication and media at the core were presented (Mapping Global Media Policy, IAMCR; Mapping Digital Media, OSI; Media Development Indicators, UNESCO; Internews) and received feedback from Southern African experts from policy and advocacy fields (Lumko Mtimde, Kate Skinner). 2. Interactive panel: Mapping Global Media Policy: future scenarios, involving IAMCR members who have been engaged with the Mapping Global Media Policy project (www.globalmediapolicy.net). 3. Two paper presentation panels: Competing and emerging practices in multi-level media policy: challenges and future trends (chaired by Marc Raboy); North-South conversations around Global Media Policy: normative standards, strategies and narratives (chaired by Arne Hintz).

Presentations on the occasion of the IAMCR conference held in Durban in 2012: 'The Mediation of Resistance' and 'The power of norms. The challenge of structuring social change through supra-national Gender-oriented Communication Governance'.

SISP Congress, Rome. Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: In the period 2001 – 2005 Padovani acted as Focal point for the University of Padova to the United Nations World Summit on the Information Society (Geneva 2003 – Tunis 2005). In this role Padovani has followed the whole preparatory process of the WSIS; preparatory conferences and events, including the World Summit of Cities in the Information Society (Lyon 2004). She also contributed research papers to the Civil Society constituency, of which, as a member of the IAMCR Task force for WSIS she was part. She also contributed to organising a number of event, including the Workshop introducing the concept of MUST, Multi-Stakeholder monitor initiative: assessing and evaluating multi-stakeholder processes. World Summit on the Information Society, Tunis.

Padovani has collaborated for years with national and international NGOs, in training activities, translating the academic knowledge derived from research into training modules on issues concerning globalization processes, communication transformations, gender equality. Amongts the NGOs she has been collaborating with: APC (Association for Progressive Communication), ITforChange (india), MLAL (Movimento Laici America Latina), WACC (World Association for Christian Communication), Cooperativa Il Sestante (Treviso), Pigrizia (rivista su Africa), CUM (Centro Unitario Missionario), COSPE, Banca Etica, CUOA, Ingegneri Senza Frontiere, ISPI (corsi di formazione estiva), COASIV, Centro Agape. In the context of international collaborations, Padovani has been one of the founding members of the international campaign CRIS (Communication Rights in the Information Society) and responsible for its research activities in Italy in the period 2003-2005.

Next Generation Global Studies@SPGI (2012 – present) Claudia Padovani has worked in close cooperation with colleagues from the SPGI Department to set up an initiative titled Next Generation Global Studies (NGGS) which aims at reconsidering predominant schemes of interpretation of global societies, in order to overcome prevailing Eurocentric perspectives of space and time. To meet its goals NGGS promotes multi-vocal, interdisciplinary and international public conversations on a number of aspects that reflect the challenges of globality, conversations that aim at informing research and educational activities at the University of Padova. NGGS also promotes an international winter intensive course, bringing together international scholars and students from a range of disciplines and geo-cultural background to discuss “the spaces and times of globalization”.

University of Padova Focal Point to the Unesco Global Alliance for Media and Gender (2013 - present) The Global Alliance for Media and Gender (GAMAG) is a global movement to promote gender equality in and through media. The GAMAG’s objectives are: to pursue gender equality in media systems, structures and content by strengthening international, regional and national cooperation in which all stakeholders work together to drive change globally; to follow-up and systematically monitor implementation of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action: ‘Women and the Media Diagnosis’; and to develop and sustain gender and media priorities including through research and educational activities.

Padovani is one of the founding members of the Mapping Global Media Policy jointly developed with McGill University, Montreal. A research and policy-oriented project aiming a building capacity to understand (and act in) the ever-changing media policy environment, through an on-line platform and collaborative off-line expert partnerships. This is a partnership between Media@McGill, a research and public outreach hub based at McGill University (Canada), and including University of Padova (Italy), Cardiff University (UK), the University of Sydney (Australia) and the Center for Media and Communication Studies (CMCS) at Central European University (Hungary). A digital platform has been created for the project, accessible at: www.globalmediapolicy.net. Collaborations have been activated for this project with the Open Society Foundation (2013/14, Budapest).

University of Padova Focal Point for the Unitwin University Network on Gender Media and ICT (2016 – present) The network aims to advance research training and program development in UNESCO’s fields of competence by building university networks and encouraging co-operation between gender, media and ICT scholars. Supporting education and research on media, information and communication technologies, the Network specifically aims to promote gender equality and women’s participation in and through media on a global scale through research, education and advocacy. Members of the network are drawn from all regions: Africa, Arab States, Asia and the Pacific, Europe and North America, and also Latin America and the Caribbean. The Network is co-chaired by RMIT and UNAM Universities. Other key beneficiaries involved in outreach activities are policy makers, NGOs, gender and media activists, experts, media corporations/practitioners. In this context Padovani is working on a set of activities focused on ‘Communication Governance and Gender Equality’ (ChANGE). Research and educational projects are being developed.

Study on Area J of the Beijing Platform for Action: Women and the Media in European Union (European tender EIGE/2012/OPER/07). A research project, jointly coordinated by Karen Ross and Claudia, Padovani focused on 27 European countries plus Croatia, aimed at developing indicators to monitor and evaluate the extent to which gender equality is being advanced in media industries, with specific emphasis on women’s employment in decision-making positions (employment), the existence of gender equality policies and their scope (employment and production), and policies relating to gender and balanced representation (production and content). Claudia padovani is senior researcher in an international consortium comprising University of Liverpool (UK, Lead Member), the University of Padova (Italy), the University of Szeged (Hungary) and the C.A.R.E.S. scrl Osservatorio di Pavia Media Research (Italy) (Allocated budget 400.000 euros). The project has evolved into a book project (Routledge in 2016, co-edited by Ross and Padovani).

Project titled ADVANCING GENDER EQUALITY IN MEDIA INDUSTRIES (EURO-AGEMI) in response to a EU DG Justice call for proposals JUST/2015/RGEN/AG/ROLE. Project funded for the period 2017-2019 (starting February 2017). Claudia Padovani is co-coordinator of the project together with Principal Investigator Prof. Karen Ross (Newcastle University, UK) and leader of the Team from the University of Padova. Main objectives: • Raise and spread awareness of gender inequalities and stereotyping among the next generation of media professionals (students) to promote an equality-focused professional practice; • Provide knowledge resources – based on good practices - to educators and media professionals to support educational and training activities to challenge gender stereotyping and foster gender equal roles. • Bridge educational and professional cultures and organizations to promote gender-aware changes in behaviour across sectors and foster gender-sensitive employability of young professional.
